intro: Cryptolepis buchananii, commonly known as African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody, branching stem and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Cryptolepis buchananii is also valued for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional African medicine.
